docs.snippet: An Australian Navy ship has seized a huge cache of weapons near Oman's coast from a fishing vessel bound for Somalia, the navy said on Monday, exposing a possible violation of a U.N. Security Council arms embargo.
docs.lead_paragraph: An Australian Navy ship has seized a huge cache of weapons near Oman's coast from a fishing vessel bound for Somalia, the navy said on Monday, exposing a possible violation of a U.N. Security Council arms embargo.

headline.main: Australian Navy Says Seizes Huge Weapons Cache Headed for Somalia
headline.print_headline: Australian Navy Says Seizes Huge Weapons Cache Headed for Somalia

docs.snippet: Sri Lanka will receive a loan of $1.5 billion from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to boost foreign exchange reserves and avert a balance of payments problem, a government minister said on Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sri Lanka will receive a loan of $1.5 billion from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to boost foreign exchange reserves and avert a balance of payments problem, a government minister said on Monday.

headline.main: Sri Lanka to Get $1.5 Billion IMF Loan to Avert Balance of Payments Woes
headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka to Get $1.5 Billion IMF Loan to Avert Balance of Payments Woes

docs.snippet: The first known ransomware attack on Apple Inc's Mac computers, which was discovered over the weekend, was downloaded more than 6,000 times before the threat was contained, according to a developer whose product was tainted with the malicious...
docs.lead_paragraph: The first known ransomware attack on Apple Inc's Mac computers, which was discovered over the weekend, was downloaded more than 6,000 times before the threat was contained, according to a developer whose product was tainted with the malicious software.

headline.main: Mac Ransomware Caught Before Large Number of Computers Infected
headline.print_headline: Mac Ransomware Caught Before Large Number of Computers Infected

docs.snippet: French utility EDF said it would push ahead with a plan to build nuclear reactors in Britain, despite its finance director quitting over the risk he sees it poses to the company's future.
docs.lead_paragraph: French utility EDF said it would push ahead with a plan to build nuclear reactors in Britain, despite its finance director quitting over the risk he sees it poses to the company's future.

headline.main: France's EDF to Pursue UK Nuclear Plan Despite CFO's Exit
headline.print_headline: France's EDF to Pursue UK Nuclear Plan Despite CFO's Exit

docs.snippet: A Japanese submarine will visit the Philippines for the first time in 15 years, along with two warships that will then sail on to Vietnam, in a show of support for nations opposed to Beijing's ambitions in the South China Sea, a person familiar with...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Japanese submarine will visit the Philippines for the first time in 15 years, along with two warships that will then sail on to Vietnam, in a show of support for nations opposed to Beijing's ambitions in the South China Sea, a person familiar with the matter said.

headline.main: Japanese Submarine to Visit Philippines: Sources
headline.print_headline: Japanese Submarine to Visit Philippines: Sources

docs.snippet: When it comes to water, only about half of Americans are very confident in the safety of what's flowing from their tap, according to an Associated Press-GfK poll, which found that trust is even weaker among minorities and people with lower incomes.
docs.lead_paragraph: When it comes to water, only about half of Americans are very confident in the safety of what's flowing from their tap, according to an Associated Press-GfK poll, which found that trust is even weaker among minorities and people with lower incomes.

headline.main: AP Poll: Americans Divided on Safety of US Drinking Water
headline.print_headline: AP Poll: Americans Divided on Safety of US Drinking Water

docs.snippet: Indian conglomerate Mahindra & Mahindra is re-thinking the strategy for its loss-making Korean automaker Ssangyong Motor Co, tapping the brakes on its planned push into the United States to focus instead on China.
docs.lead_paragraph: Indian conglomerate Mahindra & Mahindra is re-thinking the strategy for its loss-making Korean automaker Ssangyong Motor Co, tapping the brakes on its planned push into the United States to focus instead on China.

headline.main: Mahindra Re-Thinking Ssangyong Plan, Wants to Make Cars in China
headline.print_headline: Mahindra Re-Thinking Ssangyong Plan, Wants to Make Cars in China

docs.snippet: Dozens of Islamist fighters stormed through the Tunisian town of Ben Guerdan near the Libyan border on Monday, attacking army and police posts in a raid that killed at least 53 people, including civilians, the government and residents said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dozens of Islamist fighters stormed through the Tunisian town of Ben Guerdan near the Libyan border on Monday, attacking army and police posts in a raid that killed at least 53 people, including civilians, the government and residents said.

headline.main: Militants Attack Tunisian Forces Near Libyan Border, 53 Killed
headline.print_headline: Militants Attack Tunisian Forces Near Libyan Border, 53 Killed

docs.snippet: The Bank of Japan (BOJ) is expected to cut next fiscal year's economic and price forecasts at a quarterly review in April, sources say, reflecting growing gloom in the bank after its most recent stimulus measures fell on stony ground.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bank of Japan (BOJ) is expected to cut next fiscal year's economic and price forecasts at a quarterly review in April, sources say, reflecting growing gloom in the bank after its most recent stimulus measures fell on stony ground.

headline.main: Japan Central Bank to Cut Next Fiscal Year's Growth, Price Estimates
